pack.tcc.hover_event: Click here to go to the official website
pack.tcc.version.hover_event: Click here to see changelog notes
item.tcc.compendium.example_page.title: Example Entry Page
item.tcc.compendium.example_page.history: This is where the history of the item would appear.
item.tcc.compendium.example_page.contrib: This is where the contributors to this feature would appear.
item.tcc.compendium.example_page.more_in: This is where technical information would appear.
item.tcc.compendium.example_page.recipe:
This is where the recipe would appear.

Or, alternatively, where the item could be found if it doesn't have a recipe.
item.tcc.compendium.example_page.give_co: This is where you would click to get an item.
item.tcc.compendium.example_page.descrip:
This is an example.

If you hover over the icons, you can read about them. There is also usually a link in the bottom right, but this is an example, so there isn't one.

After this page, there is a feature index.
item.tcc.compendium.page.feature_hover_e: Click here to open feature page
item.tcc.compendium.page.developers_hove: Click here to open developers page

item.tcc.compendium.index_page.title: Index Page (%s/%s)
item.tcc.compendium.cover_page.content:
A comprehensive guide to all the content in The Creeper's Code.

To get another copy, run %s
item.tcc.compendium.credits.title: The Complete Credits
item.tcc.compendium.credits.creepermagne:
%s

It's me. The main guy. Yeah, I made this entire thing. I do 90 percent of the development of the pack, and I'm proud of it.
%s

Ragno is responsible for retexturing the entirety of TCC, which took a ton of effort and time. Also, go check out her datapack, Dinos and Dodos. That took her a lot of effort too.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.chromakey.de:
%s

THE MONKEY. He's my third in line. If I need a random feature done, or technical advice, I go to him. Reliable and efficient. Oh, and he has an egg named stewart.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.ellivers.des:
%s

The newest dev, who's contributed tons of high-quality code and bug-fixes. Most significantly, the block breaker code, which is now incredibly efficient. Additionally, Elli's responsible for all the custom sounds in TCC, such as the gobblerift sounds, the positional anchor sounds, and the jewelry table sound. Great coder, even better sound designer!
item.tcc.compendium.credits.jachro.descr:
%s

Art Goblin, give him money. He's made a couple textures for TCC. Supplies me with memes so my mental health doesn't decline.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.thenuclearne:
%s

Nexus has helped me during lots of phases of TCC, like figuring out the MANY MANY edge cases for jewelry tables. He's also a great friend, and all-around cool guy. Follow him on twitch.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.dragoncomman:
%s

Dragon is another dev. He does some work, but is mostly who I call to set up testing servers and use as a test dummy. He's coded a few features, and is the second-oldest dev behind me.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.skaliber.des:
%s

Skaliber makes tons of cool stuff, and has helped work out some of the general behavior of TCC features. I also stole a bunch of ideas from him, but he's cool with it. :)
item.tcc.compendium.credits.mcs.descript:
%s

An awesome forum for getting suggestions from players. I'm also partnered with them, so I get lots of suggestions for my pack from there as well. Great place!
item.tcc.compendium.credits.dpc.descript:
%s

The Datapack Center's an amazing server filled with tons of cool datapacks, along with lots of cool people too! We're also the top downloaded datapack on their website.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.hashs.descri:
%s

This gal is lazy. Whenever I see her not working on her datapack, it reminds me I should be working on mine. She has a cool pack though, demons are neat. Go download Undermagic.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.icy.descript:
%s

ICY is THE datapack guy. If you've got an idea, ICY's probably already made it, and optimized it. This guy's great. Would steal code from him again. :)
item.tcc.compendium.credits.logdotzip.de:
%s

Logdotzip is one of the main reasons the pack has grown this large. Without his showcase video, I probably wouldn't have the audience that I do now. He also owes me $20.
item.tcc.compendium.credits.artists.desc:
%s

Ninni: Retextured a whole lot of stuff, HE'S ALSO THE REASON WHY THE SWORDFISH SUCKS SO MUCH

Skaliber: Created the frostbloom textures

Primalugly: Created some other textures

Insanial: Made the locket of learning texture

Frenderman: Tried to retexture stuff lol

DMTHGM: Made the gobblerift juice animated texture
item.tcc.compendium.credits.suggestors.d:
%s

PringleBeaver: Suggested too much to list.

DylzMC: Suggested spectral boomerangs

Adequoir: Suggested wither sword lore

Lots of random people: Suggested new splashes

DMTHGM: Suggested frostblooms damaging blazes

woakey: Suggested funny easter egg

Dave Hue: Suggested "more end plants", the catalyst for the gobblerift
%s

Jragon014/Zoey: Started the entire idea of a "command block mod". Honestly, without that idea, TCC wouldn't be here.

Vazkii: He made quark, which is TCC but a mod. I'd be lying if I said I didn't take some inspiration from that.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.absorption_imp:
Skaliber: Came up with the idea
%1$s: Implemented
This effect also applies to both variants of golden apple pies.
Absorption now stacks, meaning you gain +2 (+8, if enchanted) absorption hearts every time you eat a golden apple, up to a max of 10. The effect also wears off if you lose the hearts.
%1$s: Added
%3$s: Now gives haste instead of health boost
%4$s: Can now be brewed into a tea
The Haste II effect lasts exactly two hours.

Drops from spruce leaves in mega taigas, 0.5% of the time.
Also can be found when mining podzol with fortune about 1% of the time.
Ancient acorns are found rarely in mega tree taigas, where they drop from spruce leaves, or from mining podzol with a fortune shovel. When eaten, you gain Haste II.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.anvil_repairin: This recipe works off of any damaged anvil, repairing it to full, meaning it would be smartest to use this on a heavily damaged anvil.
Anvils can now be repaired using an iron block in a smithing table. Incredibly useful, especially if you don't want to waste any iron.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.anvil_smashing:
%3$s: Added
%4$s: Can now crack blocks as well
%5$s: Can now smash amethyst blocks
When smashing glowstone, it gives all mobs in a 5-block radius glowing for a minute, and all players nausea II and haste II for 5 minutes.

Anvils dropped onto glass and amethyst blocks will smash them into a spray of particles! This also works on glowstone, which sprays out lots of fun potion effects. You can also crack blocks by dropping anvils on them too.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.apple_pie.more: You can eat this item three times, for 4 hunger the first time, 3 the second, and 2 the last.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.apple_pie.desc: Apple pie is a unique food item that can be eaten three times, as it has three slices. Don't eat the last slice of your friend's pie though, they'll get mad.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.bat_wing.more_: Since bat wings' base item is technically rabbit hide, these can also be crafted into 1.17's handy bundles!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.bat_wing.recip: Bat wings are dropped from bats, in amounts of 1-2. The chance of having two wings is increased by looting.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.bat_wing.descr: Bat wings are now dropped by bats and can be crafted into leather similarly to rabbit hide, in a 2x2 square. Helpful for early-game leather!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.better_recipes: Fun feature trivia: After V0.3, many of the blackstone recipes were implemented into vanilla.

%1$s: Implemented most recipes
%3$s: Removed many nonsensical recipes
%5$s: Added deepslate recipes
Many recipes have been improved. Stairs now have an output of 8, prismarine recipes have been generally improved, and many stone items can be crafted with blackstone or deepslate.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.biome_based_fi: As an additional bonus, salmon are more common in rivers, and pufferfish are more common in warm oceans.
Fishing is now biome-based, meaning you can find different items/fish depending on the biome you're in. For example, you get shulker shells in the end rather than nautilus shells.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.block_breakers:
%1$s: Created
%3$s: Implemented efficiency enchantments
%4$s: Rewrote majority of the code

Valid Enchantments:
 - Efficiency
 - Silk Touch
 - Fortune

Efficiency affects how many blocks the block breaker can break in front of it, while silk touch and fortune have the expected effects.

%1$s: Implemented
%2$s: Added the snipper variant
%3$s: Added the harvester variant and enchantments
%4$s: Added efficiency enchantment support and doTileDrops gamerule support
%5$s: Can now be crafted with deepslate and blackstone

Block breakers are made with any diamond tool or shears. When powered, they eat blocks, and "fart" the result out. They can be enchanted by "feeding" them enchanted books by throwing a book in front of their face and powering them.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.boomerang.hist:
%1$s: Added the boomerang
%4$s: Fixed neutral mob and wither damage
item.tcc.compendium.entry.boomerang.more:
Durability: 300

Valid Enchantments:
 - Unbreaking
 - Mending
 - Curse of Vanishing
item.tcc.compendium.entry.boomerang.desc: The boomerang is a useful weapon that can bounce off walls, hitting multiple enemies, and then come back to you! A little inaccurate, but cheaper than a bow.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.cake_improveme: There are eight possible states of cake.
Cake can now be easily broken and picked up again, without destroying the cake in the process. It also has different textures depending on the number of slices.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.campfire_impro:
Silk touch & no axe: Lit Campfire
No silk touch & no axe: Coal drops
Silk touch & axe: Lit Campfire
No silk touch & axe: Unlit Campfire
Campfires will now drop unlit campfires under certain circumstances. A full chart can be seen under the magifying glass, which shows "More Info". This feature also applies to soul campfires.
Fun feature trivia: This feature used to be for iron rings, until 1.16, in which chains were added.

%2$s: Implemented
%3$s: Changed from iron rings to chains
Saddles and chainmail armor can now be made from chains, allowing you to obtain them more easily.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.charged_music_: The thunder lasts as long as the song lasts, making "blocks" at 5:45 the best song for this feature.
Dropped from charged creepers 100% of the time when killed by skeletons or piglins.
Charged music discs are obtained from charged creepers shot and killed by skeletons or %s. They make the weather thunder when put into a jukebox.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.climbable_chai: This feature also applies when the chain is sideways, meaning you can make interesting pseudo-ladders.
Chains can now be climbed by players. Very simple feature, but fun for builds and stuff.
Since coral fans and coral plants are farmable, this makes coral blocks fully renewable.

Coral fans and normal coral can be crafted into coral blocks. This also applies to dead coral. An example recipe is given above in the "recipe" section, and all the others are in the default recipe book.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.cursed_crown.m: This feature does not affect incredibly powerful magic items, such as totems, dragon eggs, nether stars, and elytra.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.cursed_crown.h:
%3$s: Implemented
%4$s: Improved drop rates and added armor stand functionality
item.tcc.compendium.entry.cursed_crown.r: This item can be found in bastions, and can also be found by mining soul sand with a fortune shovel, about 1% of the time.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.cursed_crown.d: The cursed crown can be found by mining soul sand with a %s or in bastion loot. They change all of your mob and farming loot to gold. Yikes.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.diamond_gemsto: The normal variant gives +1 heart, the pristine variant gives +2 hearts.
The diamond gemstone is made from putting a diamond in a stonecutter. It adds the health attribute when on a %s. In order to apply it to a ring, you must use a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.drowned_loot_i:
There is a 5% to drop either prismarine crystals or sponge.
There is a 25% chance for drowned with tridents to drop their trident.
Tridents now drop from drowned with tridents in their hand more often, making them much easier to get. Drowned also drop sponge and prismarine crystals.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.elder_guardian: A small technical note: This feature does not fully get rid of all mining fatigue in an ocean monument, since there are three elder guardians. You still need to kill all three to remove the fatigue.

Elder guardians will now clear any mining fatigue effect you have when you kill them. This makes finishing off ocean monuments much easier to work with, albeit still risky due to the amount of elder guardians. See "More Info".
item.tcc.compendium.entry.elytra_closing: This feature allows you to completely mitigate "kinetic energy" damage when you run into a wall. All you need to do is simply sneak before you hit the wall, and you'll take the much smaller fall damage instead.
If you press shift mid-air when flying with elytra, they will close and you will fall. Dangerous, but it allows you to pull off tons of cool tricks!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.emerald_gemsto: With a normal emerald gemstone, mobs have a 25% of dropping double the loot. With a pristine gemstone, this is a 50% chance instead.
The emerald gemstone is made from putting an emerald in a stonecutter. It adds the luck attribute when on a %s, which increases mob loot. In order to apply it to a ring, you must use a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.emoji.title: Emoji
item.tcc.compendium.entry.emoji.more_inf: If you type "/trigger emoji set <number>", the number will print out the corresponding emoji. For example, "/trigger tcc.emoji set 10" prints a crazy emoji.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.emoji.descript: If you type "/trigger tcc.emoji" in chat, a menu will come up with 22 various emoji you can click to print out. Express yourself! But not *too* much. We don't want another emoji movie.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.enchanted_gold: Fun feature trivia: This recipe was added shortly after I read the code behind the "Balanced Diet" advancement and saw that an enchanted golden apple was required… ridiculous.
The enchanted golden apple recipe has been re-added. That's it. Having loot-exclusive items is lame.
The enchanted golden carrot gives the same amount of food bars as the normal golden carrot.
Enchanted golden carrots give you night vision for five minutes. They also clear any blindness you may have. (Same for normal golden carrots.)
item.tcc.compendium.entry.enchanter.more: Enchanters have 10 hearts, making them one of the weaker illagers.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.enchanter.reci: Enchanters can be found within the woodland mansion basement, and they also spawn in raids rarely.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.enchanter.desc: Enchanters are a powerful "support class" illager that help their illager friends with magic. They are also the main guardians of the %s. They're a direct port from Minecraft Dungeons.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.end_crystal_he: The crystal applies an effect of regeneration I for 10 seconds, and will work for multiple players at once.

%1$s: Implemented
%4$s: Removed laggy visual pointer from end crystal to player
End crystals will now heal players wearing dragon heads. Guess they aren't smart enough to tell you apart from the actual dragon.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.ender_pearl_ge: The range for a normal ender pearl gemstone is 3 blocks, while the pristine variant has a 6-block range.
The ender pearl gemstone is made from putting an ender pearl in a stonecutter. When on a %s, it teleports nearby items to you. In order to apply it to a ring, you must use a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.fortune_shovel: The loot also varies with the biome you're in. Desert sand has drastically different loot than ocean sand.

%3$s: Implemented
%4$s: This feature now applies to block breakers. Some loot has also been tweaked as well.
Shovels enchanted with fortune will now get loot when mining sand-like blocks, such as podzol, soul sand, and mycelium. This effect also applies to the sifter %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frost_walker_i: The horse frost walker only functions when you're riding the horse. That way, your horses won't randomly escape across oceans.

%3$s: Implemented horse frost walker
%4$s: Implemented ice speed

Frost walker has undergone many tweaks. First off, when riding a horse and wearing frost walker boots, the horse will also leave a trail of ice. Additionally, you'll move faster when you walk on packed, normal and blue ice with frost walker.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frostbloom.con:
%1$s: Created
%3$s: Implemented snow feature
DMTHGM: Suggested blaze damage
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frostbloom.mor: The rate at which the frostbloom lays down snow is proportional to the random tick speed. This means you can run "/gamerule randomTickSpeed 1000", and it'll start snowing at super-speed. This also occurs when you bone-meal it.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frostbloom.rec:
Can be found in the tundra keep, 100% of the time.
Iceologers also drop it about 5% of the time.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frostbloom.des: The frostbloom is an incredibly potent magical flower, found in %s. It freezes blocks, makes snow around it, damages blazes, and heals snow golems. It also drops %s when bone-mealed.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frostbloom_pet: The regeneration effect lasts 15 seconds, while the ice lasts 30 seconds. This makes it sub-par for PvP, but it's still very powerful for PvE.
Dropped from strays 5% of the time, and dropped by iceologers 50% of the time.

When eaten, these petals give you regeneration, as well as slowness and an icy screen overlay. They are dropped by %s when bone-mealed, and are dropped by strays and %s. They can be made into a %s too.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.gemstones.more: There is a 10% chance a gemstone turns pristine when crafting in a stonecutter.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.gemstones.desc: Gemstones can be applied to %s using a %s to give them attributes. They're made by putting %s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s, or %s into a stonecutter. There's also a rare "pristine" variant with 2x stats.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.golden_apple_p: This feature is also affected by the "absorption improvements" feature. The effects given by the pie also decrease depending on the size of the piece you're eating.
Golden apple pie is the golden variant of %s. It can also be eaten three times to get golden apple potion effects. Three for two. Nice! There's an enchanted variant too.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.golden_chorus_: The maximum distance that you can teleport using this feature is 2000 blocks. However, it's completely random, so you're more likely to get around 1000 blocks.

Golden chorus fruit is the golden variant of normal chorus fruit. Similarly to its golden apple cousin, it has increased effects due to the gold added to it. In this case, rather than teleporting you a short distance, it teleports you very far.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.golden_ring.mo:
Durability: 50

Valid Enchantments:
 - Mending
 - Unbreaking
 - Thorns 
 - Flame
 - Channeling
 - Curse of Vanishing
item.tcc.compendium.entry.golden_ring.hi:
%2$s: Implemented
%3$s: Added gemstone support
%4$s: Is now unstackable
item.tcc.compendium.entry.golden_ring.de: This ring is the gold variant of the %s, and can also be used in a %s for different outcomes, such as longer potions with lower durability.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.grace_potion.c:
%3$s: Created
%1$s: Fixed and added jewelry table functionality
item.tcc.compendium.entry.grace_potion.m: Fun feature trivia: Until V0.4, this feature didn't actually give you any potion effects when thrown on the ground. Thanks, Chroma.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.grace_potion.h:
%3$s: Implemented
%4$s: Can now be used on rings and swords
item.tcc.compendium.entry.grace_potion.r: Drops from the "treasure" section of the fishing loot table about 10% of the time.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.grace_potion.d: Lingering potions of dolphin's grace can now be found rarely when fishing. Apply them to your %s or %s. Alternatively, you can also use them on yourself... but that's a bit wasteful.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.heads.title: Heads
item.tcc.compendium.entry.heads.more_inf: As of V0.3, heads can now be crafted, making them hardcore-friendly. Making TCC hardcore-friendly is a very important design pillar for us.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.heads.descript: Blazes, endermen, husks, strays, dragons, drowned, and players killed by charged creepers will now drop their heads. You can also craft your own head using the listed recipe.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.iceologer.more: Iceologers have 20 hearts, making them very durable, and even more deadly.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.iceologer.reci: Spawns naturally in the tundra keep and in raids in snowy areas
item.tcc.compendium.entry.iceologer.desc: Iceologers are very dangerous illager magicians that can summon massive blocks of falling ice. They will freeze you directly if you decide to retreat underneath cover. They also drop %s, and spawn in the %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.iron_ring.more:
Durability: 100

Valid Enchantments:
 - Mending
 - Unbreaking
 - Thorns 
 - Flame
 - Channeling
 - Curse of Vanishing
item.tcc.compendium.entry.iron_ring.hist:
%1$s: Implemented
%3$s: Added gemstone support
%4$s: Is now unstackable
item.tcc.compendium.entry.iron_ring.desc: The iron ring is a new item that can be ornamented with gemstones via a %s, and have %s and enchantments as well. It's an incredibly useful tool.
Ring Enchantments:
 - Mending
 - Unbreaking
 - Thorns 
 - Flame
 - Channeling
 - Curse of Vanishing

Can also be used to repair gemstone rings by re-adding the same type of gemstone

Used to apply %s, %s, and enchantments to %s. Also, some of the ring enchantments have different effects than usual. Flame sets mobs that hit you on fire, while channeling works as a melee version of the trident channeling.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.jungle_temple_: Fun feature trivia: This is likely the smallest TCC feature ever. So small, this paragraph of text you're reading is actually longer than the actual description of the feature.
Jungle temple dispensers now have poison arrows, rather than normal arrows. Incredibly simple!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.lapis_lazuli_g: The normal variant gives 1 bonus xp point per kill, while the pristine variant gives 2 per kill.

The lapis lazuli gemstone is made from putting lapis lazuli in a stonecutter. It adds the mob XP bonus attribute when on a %s, which gives you bonus XP on kills. In order to apply it to a ring, you must use a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.levitation_sus: You can now make suspicious stew from chorus flowers to give yourself a short amount of levitation. Useful for getting out of caves and such.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.locket_of_lear: Fun feature trivia: The locket can store exactly one point less than 30 levels. This is due to an odd quirk in which the points needed to make 30 levels is a number with very few factors.
The locket is dropped 2.5% of the time by enchanters, and always spawns at least once in the woodland mansion basement.
The locket is a helpful enchanting tool. On right-click, it stores experience points, and when shift-right-clicked, it gives you points back. It is dropped by %s, and can be found in %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.loot_table_imp: Fun feature trivia: The amount of iron nuggets dropped by zombies is the same rate at which zombie pigmen drop golden nuggets. In fact, that is what inspired the feature.

This datapack makes some changes to loot tables. Zombies drop iron nuggets, spiders drop cobwebs rarely, zombie villagers drop emeralds rarely, and shulkers drop 1-2 shells, instead of 0-1. jeb_ sheep will also now drop a random wool on death.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.nether_reactor: The reactor will only clear wither I, so the reactor cannot be used to easily defeat the wither, which gives wither II.

쀗

    Reactor Assembly

 Bottom쀡 Middle   쀡Top

 쀙쀘쀙    쀘쀡쀘    쀡쀘쀡
 쀘쀘쀘    쀡쀠쀡    쀘쀘쀘
 쀙쀘쀙    쀘쀡쀘    쀡쀘쀡

The nether reactor gives friendlies fire resistance, gives striders Speed III, and clears Wither I in a 64 block radius. It is activated by placing blocks in the pattern shown in the recipe, with the 'core' in the middle.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.obsidian_gemst: The normal variant gives +1 knockback resistance, while the pristine variant gives +2.
The obsidian gemstone is made from putting an %s in a stonecutter. It adds the knockback resistance attribute when on a %s. In order to apply it to a ring, you must use a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.obsidian_mirro: This item takes damage per potion effect flipped, and it also takes damage based on the amplifier of the potion effect. For example, flipping poison IV would take four durability.
The obsidian mirror, made from %s, flips all of your negative effects into positive ones at the cost of durability.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.obsidian_recip: The crying obsidian recipe smelts slightly faster than usual, at 150% speed.

%1$s: Implemented obsidian shard recipe
%3$s: Implemented crying obsidian smelting
Crying obsidian can now be smelted into normal obsidian, and obsidian can now be crafted with 4 %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.obsidian_scyth: The maximum range for the scythe "reaping" is four blocks from the player.
This farming tool can mine entire groups of crops in one swoop, replanting the seeds as it goes. It's also a decent weapon, and is made from %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.obsidian_shard: It takes a full 30 seconds to smelt one obsidian shard.

%1$s: Implemented
%2$s: Can now only be made in blast furnaces
%3$s: Can now be used to craft smoldering seekers and obsidian gemstones
The obsidian shard is a crafting item used for multiple items, such as %s, %s, %s, and %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.paintbrush.mor: The paintbrush automatically prioritizes the dye that is in your offhand. Makes for easy organization when building.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.paintbrush.des: The paintbrush is a tool that can be used in conjunction with dyes in order to dye blocks. It can be used on concrete, shulker boxes, and many other things. It can also cycle paintings' art and color shulkers.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.peculiar_berri: The chance for a spawn egg is 25%, while the other 75% would be normal eggs.

Peculiar berries are sold by wandering traders and by %s. If you feed them to a chicken, said chicken will rarely lay spawn eggs based on the biome or structure it's in. For example, it could lay a husk egg in the desert.
Traded by wandering traders and witches
item.tcc.compendium.entry.pig_improvemen: The chance for having 3 pigs is 50%
In order to make pigs a better mob, and allow them to keep up with other livestock, they will now have 2-3 babies when breeding, rather than just one.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.pigstep_from_p: Fun feature trivia: This feature was coded after I got sick and tired looking for bastions.
Creepers killed by a piglin with a bow will now drop a pigstep disc. Jam out to nether tunes even if you don't have bastions nearby!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.positional_anc: Positional anchors will also give out a comparator signal when filled, allowing you to attach even more fun redstone to it.

The positional anchor is a useful technical block. When you insert an ender pearl inside it and power it, it will fire said ender pearl, teleporting you. It's very efficient for multiplayer or short-distance transport.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.prismarine_cry: The normal variant gives +10% attack speed, while the pristine variant gives +20%.
The prismarine crystal gemstone is made from putting prismarine crystals in a stonecutter. It adds the attack speed attribute when on a %s. In order to apply it to a ring, you must use a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.quartz_gemston: The normal variant gives +10% attack damage, while the pristine variant gives +20%.
The quartz gemstone is made from putting quartz in a stonecutter. It adds the attack damage attribute when on a %s. In order to apply it to a ring, you must use a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.quest_book.mor: Completed quest books give a reward of 6 to 9 emerald blocks.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.quest_book.rec: Traded by cartographers. Price varies depending on type of quest.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.quest_book.des: Quest books are sold by cartographers. If you complete their advancement objectives, you can collect an emerald reward. There are four kinds of quest, each with special tasks: Rogue, Mage, Healer, and Warrior.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.rotten_porkcho: Gives nausea for 30 seconds and also angers all zombified piglins in the area.
Dropped by zoglins and zombified piglins.
This food item drops from zombified piglins and zoglins, and replaces their rotten flesh drop. Make sure you cook it before eating.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.silk_touch_imp: Fun feature trivia: The grass path feature was implemented after I started going insane trying to make a path.

%3$s: Implemented
%5$s: Removed cauldrons due to Mojang removing functionality, added ability to silk touch infested deepslate
Silk touch now picks up farmland, grass paths, filled composters, infested blocks, moonlight detectors, charged respawn anchors, and note blocks.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.smoldering_see:
%1$s: Created
Hinge: Suggested ruined portal loot
Fun feature trivia: This feature was implemented shortly after I spent two hours unsuccessfully trying to find a nether fortress.

%3$s: Implemented
%4$s: Added to ruined portal loot

Smoldering seekers are special compasses crafted with %s that point to nether fortresses when clicked in the nether. No more searching for eons! They can also be bound to lodestones and found in ruined portal loot.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.soaked_rings.m: The total potion duration lasts about as long as a normal potion does, with a few small exceptions.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.soaked_rings.d: %s and %s rings can be soaked in potions by dropping them in a lingering cloud or by applying a lingering potion via %s. You get a small amount of their effect on right-click, using up durability.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.soul_sand_smel: This recipe smelts twice as fast as normal glass, because spooky reasons.
Soul sand can now be smelted into glass. This allows you to get glass from just the nether, for you weirdos that want to play nether-only survival.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.spectral_boome:
Durability: 300

Valid Enchantments:
 - Unbreaking
 - Mending
 - Curse of Vanishing
The spectral boomerang is the glowing version of the %s, crafted with glowstone. It can pass through walls and make mobs glow, but doesn't deal any damage. Incredibly useful for finding caves.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.squid_ink_blin: When you damage a squid, they will now give blind all mobs in the surrounding water. You can use this in conjunction with creepers to make some lingering potion clouds… perhaps you can use this on %s or %s?
item.tcc.compendium.entry.sweet_berry_mu: Fun feature trivia: This feature was implemented after I started going insane after accidentally planting my berries hundreds of times over.
Sweet berry muffins are a tasty food item. They're also superior to eating plain sweet berries, since you can't accidentally plant them.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.swordfish.more: Fun feature trivia: Even I don't know if it's a food or a weapon.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.swordfish.hist:
%1$s: Implemented
%2$s: Added the ability to eat
item.tcc.compendium.entry.swordfish.reci: Can be fished up about 1% of the time.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.swordfish.desc: The swordfish is a food... or is it a weapon? I don't know. You can figure it out yourself when you fish one up.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.title: Tea
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.more_info:
Dandelion: Nausea
Wither Rose: Wither
Glowstone Dust: Blindness
Ink Sac: Glowing
Blaze Powder: Weakness
Rabbit's Foot: Bad Luck
Honey Bottle: Poison
Sweet Berries: Hunger
Riftjuice: Levitation
Frostbloom Petals: Slowness
Ancient Acorn: Mining Fatigue

The last three of these are
special TCC items, which each
have their own entries within
this compendium.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.descriptio: Tea is a useful remedy to negative potion effects. It is made using a %s and %s. Each tea gives a 5-minute immunity to a specific negative effect depending on the ingredients used. A list can be found under 'More Info'.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.teapot.more_in: Tea cannot be brewed in a teapot if the campfire is not lit.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.teapot.descrip: The teapot is used to create %s using %s. To begin, you must put the teapot on top of a lit campfire and fill it with water. Then, add the wart and your ingredient of choice, and take it out using a teacup. (Recipe shown on '%1$s' page.)
Swords can now be tipped in potion effects by dropping them in lingering potion clouds. If you hit a mob with a tipped sword, they get the sword's effect, and some of the potion's durablitity will wear off the sword.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.totem_improvem: Fun feature trivia: Originally, this feature gave you fire resistance if you died in lava, but that was shortly implemented into vanilla.
Totems of Undying will now give you water breathing if you died in water, and also levitation and slow falling if you fall in the void.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.trident_repair: This feature will remove any enchantments on the trident as well, so be careful.
Tridents can now be repaired by surrounding a trident with eight prismarine crystals.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tundra_keep.mo: This structure is technically a pillager outpost, so it spawns nearby villages and can be found using village or pillage explorer maps.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tundra_keep.re: Can be found in mountain biomes, snowy taiga biomes, and the snowy tundra.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tundra_keep.de: The tundra keep is a heavily guarded snowy illager fort, surrounded by %s and pillagers. Inside the structure, there are several valuable loot chests, and the main treasure... %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.village_beehiv: This feature only applies to savannah, taiga, and plains villages.
Some village farm plots now spawn with a beehive. These beehives even include 1-2 bees inside. Easy bees for your towns!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.village_or_pil: Since pillager outposts spawn nearby villages, the 'pillage' variant of this item is much more valuable.
Traded by wandering traders for 1-3 emeralds.
This explorer map can lead you to either a village or a pillager outpost. It's a 50/50 chance for either, and you won't know until you follow the map. Good luck!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.villager_trade: 'Cycling' trades will show how much they have left with a little number next to the trade, and they will continually crack in the GUI, as if they're breaking.
Masons now sell pristine %s, while toolsmiths sell %s. Both of these trades 'cycle', which means they change after four refreshes.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.warped_wart.mo: Fun feature trivia: I came up with this feature after realizing warped roots were practically useless. I'm still thinking of uses for the crimson variants...
item.tcc.compendium.entry.warped_wart.de: A key ingredient in making %s. Not very useful outside of that. There's also a warped wart block recipe added, requiring 2 nether wart and 2 warped roots, which doesn't quite deserve its own entry.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.witch_hat.more: Witch hats will only drop if you kill the witch by hand, meaning that witch farms won't get clogged up.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.witch_hat.hist:
%1$s: Implemented
%4$s: Can now be used in witch trading, drop rate has been tripled, and added armor stand functionality
item.tcc.compendium.entry.witch_hat.desc: Witch hats are a fun hat you can wear to look cool. They're dropped by witches. They can also be used to disguise yourself as a witch for %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.witch_hat.reci: Dropped from witches about 7.5% of the time
Witches don't like it when you hit them, so they get mad if you do that while trading...

If you wear a %s and approach a witch with no other players around, they will offer you various trades, such as buying potion ingredients and selling plants and materials for spider eyes. They even sell %s!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.woodland_mansi: There is always at least one locket of learning, inside the one major loot room at the back of the 'top' basement floor.
Can be found at the backside of every set of woodland mansion entrance stairs.

The woodland mansion basement is a very dangerous sub-section of the woodland mansion. Filled with %s and other illagers, this area boasts lots of danger and lots of enchanting loot, including the %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.wrench.more_in: Wrenches can even rotate closed iron trapdoors to open them.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.wrench.history:
%1$s: Implemented
%4$s: Optimized and added more supported blocks
item.tcc.compendium.entry.wrench.descrip: The wrench is a useful tool used to rotate lots of blocks. Chests, pillars, logs, etc. They can also see how many bees are in a hive and measure horse statistics.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.gobblerift.mor: The amount of food it takes to fill a gobblerift is about 32 pieces. This can vary depending on your luck.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.gobblerift.rec: Found in end city additions rarely
item.tcc.compendium.entry.gobblerift.des: The gobblerift is a very unique carnivorous plant found within %s in a growable seedling form. After growing to full size, it will become hungry. If you feed it enough meat, it will begin digesting and form %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.riftjuice_bott: Riftjuice displays the custom name and coordinates of the gobblerift it's harvested from in its lore.
Harvested from fully-grown gobblerifts that have digested meat

Riftjuice is a special liquid harvested from full-size %s that have digested some meat. When drank, riftjuice teleports you back to the location of the gobblerift you took it from. This doesn't work if the gobblerift is broken or moved.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.end_city_addit: On average, an end city will have about one addition. Collecting the data for this measurement was very fun™.
Found attached to the bottom of large towers on end cities.

End city additions are special sub-sections of the end city that spawn rarely off of normal end cities. They are filled with lots of loot, including their major treasure, the %s. However, watch out for the multitudes of shulkers.
item.tcc.enchanted_golden_apple_pie_slic: Slice of Enchanted Golden Apple Pie

commands.tcc.initiate.incompatible: The world you have loaded is running an older version of The Creeper's Code and will be incompatible. Please create a new world, or proceed at your own risk of broken content.

chat.tcc.gamerules.charged_discs.descrip: Toggle charged discs changing the weather
chat.tcc.gamerules.gobblerift_meat_nbt.d: Toggle the gobblerift eating meat that has custom NBT in it
chat.tcc.gamerules.gobblerift_breeding.d: Toggle the ability to breed gobblerifts with rabbit stew
death.tcc.boomerang: %s didn't realize that boomerangs come back
death.tcc.swordfish: %s impaled themselves from the inside out using a swordfish

advancements.tcc.quests.mage.01.descript: Kill a zombie with a splash potion
advancements.tcc.quests.mage.02.title: Spectral Send-off
advancements.tcc.quests.mage.02.descript: Slay a zombie using a spectral arrow
advancements.tcc.quests.mage.03.title: Taste of Their Own Medicine
advancements.tcc.quests.mage.03.descript: Kill a husk with a fire aspect sword
advancements.tcc.quests.mage.root.title: Mage's Quest
advancements.tcc.quests.mage.root.descri: A magical quest to the ends of the earth

advancements.tcc.quests.healer.03.title: Brewer

advancements.tcc.quests.rogue.02.title: Eagleeye
advancements.tcc.quests.rogue.02.descrip: Shoot and kill a zombie from 30 blocks away
advancements.tcc.quests.rogue.03.title: Stealthy
advancements.tcc.quests.rogue.04.title: Poison Master

advancements.tcc.quests.rogue.root.descr: A quest of attacking and adventure
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.beg: Begin a quest from a cartographer
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.wit: Make a trade with a witch while wearing a witch hat
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.kil: Find and kill an iceologer in their tundra keep home in the mountains
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.obt: Take a frostbloom from the depths of a tundra keep in the mountains
Obtain a useful enchanting tool from the basement of a woodland mansion and use it to store some XP
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.tip_sword: Tip a sword in a lingering potion
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.eat_golde: Coat a chorus fruit in gold and take a bite. Who knows where you could end up!
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.feed_gobb: Find a unique plant from a special section of an end city, grow it to full size, and feed it some meat
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.breed_gob: Grow two gobblerifts to full size, place them next to eachother, and breed them using rabbit stew
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.drink_rif: Drink some riftjuice from a gobblerift using a glass bottle after feeding it plenty of meat and waiting for it to digest
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.use_posit: Use an ender pearl on a positional anchor to be activated later with redstone
advancements.tcc.minecraft.husbandry.pec: Feed a chicken some berries acquired from a wandering villager
advancements.tcc.minecraft.husbandry.spa: Use a spawn egg on a monster spawner to change what it spawns
advancements.tcc.minecraft.husbandry.eat: Eat the last piece of a pie
advancements.tcc.minecraft.story.obsidia: Smelt down obsidian into a shard in a blast furnace
Use an obsidian mirror to flip negative potion effects
advancements.tcc.minecraft.story.iron_ri: It's Got a Ring to It
advancements.tcc.minecraft.story.gemston: Cut a crystalline item into a gemstone via stonecutter
advancements.tcc.minecraft.story.bad_nam: Obtain a Pristine Prismarine Crystal Gemstone
advancements.tcc.minecraft.story.used_je: Add a gemstone to a ring via a jewelry table
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.cursed: Wear a strange crown received from the depths of the nether
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.teapot: Take some brewed tea from a teapot using a teacup
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.smolde: Use a smoldering seeker in the nether to get the location of a fortress
